item.title: My video editing process
item.author: vinod@kurup.com (Vinod Kurup, MD)
item.description: I use kino to edit the videos that we take of the kids. I haven’t found a Linux program which was as nice as iMovie was on the Mac, but kino is pretty good. It’s easy to splice and reconnect video clips together. It has nice special effects, though my needs are pretty simple. It’s able to export in plenty of formats, possibly too many, for my simple mind. But, I’ve figured it out and have a stable process for getting video from camera to youtube.
